result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael Joseph Whitney was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Michael Joseph Whitney is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Michael Joseph Whitney was found guilty of Sex Offender - Fail/Update Information, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 301.45(4)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

08-11-2014  
PER PROBATION REVIEW - THE COURT WILL TERMINATE PROBATION EFFECTIVE 08-11-2014.  COURT COSTS
 WILL BE REDUCED TO A CIVIL JUDGMENT.

supervisions.notes:
08-11-2014: 30 DAY JAIL SENTENCE ORDERED AFTER COURT TERMINATED PROBATION.
Jail sentence WITH HUBER PRIVILEGES may be served in Pierce, Pepin, St Croix, Dunn or Polk County

ADDRESS INFO for Michael Joseph Whitney

11:23 Defendant Michael Joseph Whitney in court with attorney Liesl E. Nelson.  William H. Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Thorie revoke probation 30 days jail sentence. Huber. Nelson agrees. Sentence is not being revoked. Defendant agrees.  Court orders.  Sentence modified. Removed probation.  30 Day Jail Sentence to begin August 15, 2014 at 7:00 p.m.  Huber law allowed. 11:31

10:25 Defendant Michael Joseph Whitney in court with attorney Liesl E. Nelson.  Defendant Michael Joseph Whitney in custody.  William H. Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. THorie: guilty to Ct#1 in information. 2 years probation. conditions: comply with sex offender registry for the duration of his probation. Nelson and Deg agree.  Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with Def.  Constitutional rights explained to defendant.  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights. Def pleas guilty to Ct#1 contained in the information; Nelson stipulates to factual basis for charge.  COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS. Court finds and adjudicates Def guilty to Ct#1 contained in the information; dismisses Ct#2. Thorie addresses sentencing; probation, Lock and Load fees. Nelson addresses sentencing; requests 1 year probation. Court: S/W  2 years probations. conditions: compliance with sex offender registry requirements. court costs. DNA sample and DNA surchage. Appeal rights given to Def.
Plea hearing on July 15, 2014 at 10:15 am.
Pre-trial conference on July 14, 2014 at 02:45 pm.
Information Filed with the Court and a copy is given to the defendant.  Charges read to the defendant.    DEF PLEADS NOT GUILTY TO ALL COUNTS.

1:41 pm 
Defendant Michael Joseph Whitney in court with attorney Liesl E Nelson.  Defendant Michael Joseph Whitney in custody.  William H Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sarah Palmer, S/W DOC Sex Offender Specialist sworn and examined by William Thorie.  She has tracked def since October, 2013.  If he is homeless, he must contact DOC every 7 days.  Witness IDs the defendant.    The court finds probable cause and binds defendant over for further proceedings.
Preliminary hearing on June 23, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

3:19  Defendant Michael Joseph Whitney in court with attorney Liesl E Nelson who appears by telephone. Michael Joseph Whitney in custody.  William H Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant has copy of complaint  Judge reviews the complaint with the defendant. Defendant waives further reading of the complaint.3:22  Break for the defendant to speak to Atty Nelson in private.  3:24 Court resumes    Constitutional rights explained to defendant   Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights  Bond is set If defendant mother would appear in front of the court and discuss where the defendant  will live court would consider a sign bond at that time.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 23, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
